title: PICK YOUR POT
subtitle: What’s your go-to cooking vessel? Whether it’s your skillet, air fryer, electric multicooker, or slow cooker, you can put it to great use with these simple recipes.

components.text: 5INGREDIENT RECIPES
PICK YOUR POT
What’s your go-to cooking vessel? Whether it’s your skillet, air fryer, electric multicooker, or slow cooker, you can put it to great use with these simple recipes.

Make It in a
Skillet
Red Curry Chicken

HANDS-ON 15 MIN TOTAL 30 MIN SERVES 4
SUBMITTED BY CULINARY ENVY
19 REVIEWS
Serve this simple curry with fresh basil and sliced chile pepper, plus lime wedges for squeezing.

components.html:
1(7-oz.) pkg. dried rice stick vermicelli noodles
2Tbsp. olive oil or vegetable oil
1lb. boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-size pieces
¼tsp. salt
1(14-oz.) can unsweetened coconut milk
1cup water
¼cup red curry paste

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Soak noodles in hot water 2 minutes; drain.
<lede>2.</lede> Heat oil in a large skillet over high heat. Season chicken with salt. Cook until browned, about 4 minutes.

<lede>3.</lede> Stir in drained noodles, coconut milk, water, and red curry paste. Bring mixture to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, until sauce is creamy and chicken is no longer pink, about 5 minutes.
armagazine.com/red-curry-chicken
HIDDEN GEM | QUICK | GLUTEN-FREE
PER SERVING (1½ CUPS): 579 CAL; 26G FAT (16G SAT); 29G PRO; 51G CARB (3G FIBER, 2G SUGARS); 911MG SODIUM

Make It in a
Skillet
Chicken-Fried Chicken

HANDS-ON 30 MIN TOTAL 40 MIN SERVES 6
SUBMITTED BY CASSJW
2,498 REVIEWS

components.html:
Vegetable oil, for frying (about 2 cups)
¾cup crushed saltine crackers (about 21 crackers)
2Tbsp. dry potato flakes
2Tbsp. flour
1tsp. seasoned salt
½tsp. black pepper
1egg
1Tbsp. water
6(6- to 8-oz.) boneless, skinless chicken breasts

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat until it reaches 350°F, 10 to 15 minutes.
<lede>2.</lede> Meanwhile, put crushed crackers, potato flakes, flour, seasoned salt, and pepper in a large zip-top plastic bag. Seal bag, then shake to mix well.
<lede>3.</lede> Whisk egg with the water in a shallow bowl. Dip each chicken breast in egg mixture, then put in bag with crumb mixture. Seal bag and shake to coat.
<lede>4.</lede> Add chicken to hot oil in skillet; cook, turning frequently, 15 to 20 minutes, until golden brown and an instant-read thermometer inserted into thickest parts registers 165°F.
armagazine.com/chicken-fried-chicken
HEALTHY
PER BREAST: 327 CAL; 13G FAT (2G SAT); 41G PRO; 9G CARB (1G FIBER, 0G SUGARS); 410MG SODIUM

“I dredged the chicken in a bowl with ½ cup flour and a little seasoned salt, then in a second bowl with the egg, and then in a third bowl with the crumbs.”
– SHEILA L.
Honey-Apple Pork Chops

HANDS-ON 10 MIN TOTAL 25 MIN SERVES 4
SUBMITTED BY CHRISTIE BIGGERS
111 REVIEWS

components.html:
4(1-inch-thick) boneless or bone-in pork chops (about 2¼ lb.)
½tsp. salt
½tsp. black pepper
1Tbsp. olive oil
2apples, cut into wedges [You could substitute 4 fresh apricots or peaches.]
3cloves garlic, minced
2Tbsp. honey
1Tbsp. chopped fresh sage

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Pat chops dry with paper towels; season both sides with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat; brown chops 3 to 5 minutes per side.

<lede>2.</lede> Stir in apples, garlic, and honey. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, covered, about 5 minutes, until pork is tender and an instant-read thermometer inserted into centers registers 145°F. Sprinkle with sage.
armagazine.com/honey-apple-pork-chops
HEALTHY | QUICK | GLUTEN-FREE
PER SERVING: 303 CAL; 8G FAT (2G SAT); 43G PRO; 14G CARB (1G FIBER, 12G SUGARS); 246MG SODIUM

“I seared the meat about four minutes per side. I then removed the pork, added the sauce, and simmered until it thickened up a bit. I returned the meat to the pan and simmered only five or so minutes.”
– ASCHILL

“I added a lot more honey and used canned apricots. Be generous with salt on the chops. I served this with rice to absorb some sauce. A big hit!”
– TIERA CONYERS-EVERITT

Make It in an
Air fryer
Air Fryer Ribeye Steak

HANDS-ON 5 MIN TOTAL 2 HR, 25 MIN SERVES 2
SUBMITTED BY ALAN
15 REVIEWS

components.html:
⅓cup less-sodium soy sauce
3Tbsp. olive oil
1Tbsp. Montreal Steak Seasoning or other grill seasoning
2(1½-inch-thick) ribeye steaks
1Tbsp. water

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Put soy sauce, oil, and steak seasoning in a large zip-top plastic bag; seal and shake to combine. Add steaks to bag; seal and turn to coat. Chill at least 2 hours.
<lede>2.</lede> Remove steaks from bag, discarding marinade, and pat off excess oil with paper towels.

<lede>3.</lede> Add about 1 Tbsp. water to air fryer pan (to prevent smoking) and preheat to 400°F. Arrange steaks in a single layer in fryer basket; cook 5 minutes. Turn steaks; cook until desired doneness (145°F for medium-rare), 5 to 10 minutes.
<lede>4.</lede> Remove steaks from air fryer and let stand about 4 minutes before serving.
armagazine.com/air-fryer-ribeye-steak
HIDDEN GEM
PER STEAK: 419 CAL; 21G FAT (7G SAT); 57G PRO; 0G CARB (0G FIBER, 0G SUGARS); 405MG SODIUM

“My husband was so upset that I was putting our ribeyes in the air fryer—until they came out! He was amazed. When it’s just the two of us, we will probably never grill our steak again.”
– TBURGESS
Scallops With Lemon-Herb Sauce
<lede>HANDS-ON</lede> 10 MIN <lede>TOTAL</lede> 20 MIN <lede>SERVES</lede> 2
NEW RECIPE GO ONLINE TO RATE & REVIEW
Be sure to cook the scallops to temperature. They may not brown in the fryer, so don’t wait for a golden crust to tell you they’re ready.

components.html:
8large sea scallops (8 oz. total), rinsed and patted dry
¼tsp. black pepper
⅛tsp. salt
¼cup olive oil
2Tbsp. chopped parsley, plus more for garnish
2tsp. finely chopped capers
1tsp. finely grated lemon zest
½tsp. finely chopped garlic
Lemon wedges (optional)

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Preheat an air fryer to 400°F. Coat fryer basket with cooking spray.

<lede>2.</lede> Sprinkle scallops with pepper and salt. Arrange scallops in fryer basket and coat with cooking spray. Cook about 6 minutes, or until an instant-read thermometer inserted in centers registers 120°F.
<lede>3.</lede> Meanwhile, stir together oil, parsley, capers, lemon zest, and garlic in a small bowl; drizzle sauce over scallops. Garnish with parsley leaves and lemon wedges (if using).
armagazine.com/scallops-with-lemon-herb-sauce
HEALTHY | QUICK | GLUTEN-FREE
PER 4-SCALLOP SERVING: 348 CAL; 30G FAT (4G SAT); 14G PRO; 5G CARB (0G FIBER, 0G SUGARS); 660MG SODIUM

“I never would have thought to put scallops in the air fryer, but I will never cook them any other way. Super easy recipe to follow for a fresh and delicious dinner on the table in no time!”
– ALLY SORRELLS
Instant Pot Barbecued Beef Ribs

HANDS-ON 10 MIN TOTAL 1 HR SERVES 4
SUBMITTED BY SHARRON
291 REVIEWS
Sprinkle these ribs with sliced green onion just before serving.

components.html:
1½cups water
1cup ketchup
1(6-oz.) can tomato paste
¾cup packed brown sugar
½cup cider vinegar
2Tbsp. yellow mustard
1¼tsp. salt
4lb. beef short ribs or beef back ribs

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Mix together water, ketchup, tomato paste, brown sugar, vinegar, mustard, and salt in an electric multicooker, stirring to dissolve brown sugar and salt. Add ribs and turn to coat.

<lede>2.</lede> Close and lock lid. Select High Pressure and set timer for 30 minutes. (Allow about 9 minutes for pressure to build.) Let pressure release naturally, about 10 minutes. Carefully remove lid. Transfer ribs to a platter. Serve with sauce after skimming off fat.
armagazine.com/slow-cooker-barbecued-beef-ribs
GLUTEN-FREE
PER SERVING (7¼ OZ. MEAT WITHOUT BONES AND ¼ CUP SAUCE): 765 CAL; 31G FAT (13G SAT); 55G PRO; 66G CARB (2G FIBER, 58G SUGARS); 1,547MG SODIUM

“Terrific! I seasoned the ribs with salt and pepper, then seared them on all sides before adding to the cooker. That provides a caramelized crust on the ribs.”
– LORI

Make It in an
Electric multicooker
Instant Pot Frozen Salmon

HANDS-ON 5 MIN TOTAL 20 MIN SERVES 4
SUBMITTED BY CAROL CASTELLUCCI MILLER
18 REVIEWS

components.html:
1cup cold water
¼cup lemon juice
4frozen salmon fillets (about 1 lb.)
¼tsp. salt
⅛tsp. black pepper
1lemon, cut into wedges

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Add water and lemon juice to an electric multicooker. Insert a steamer rack and spray with cooking spray. Arrange salmon, skin sides down, on rack (fillets may overlap slightly).
<lede>2.</lede> Cover and lock lid. Set on High Pressure and bring up to pressure. Immediately quick-release steam. Salmon should flake easily with a fork.
<lede>3.</lede> Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve with lemon wedges.
armagazine.com/instant-pot-frozen-salmon
HEALTHY | QUICK | GLUTEN-FREE
PER FILLET: 243 CAL; 15G FAT (4G SAT); 24G PRO; 4G CARB (1G FIBER, 1G SUGARS); 215MG SODIUM

“I added cauliflower to the pot before the salmon. I also used lots of dill on the salmon.”
– SEQUOYAH KEARNS
Sweet-and-Sour Brisket

HANDS-ON 15 MIN TOTAL 3 HR, 10 MIN SERVES 10
SUBMITTED BY LOUISE
157 REVIEWS

components.html:
4lb. beef brisket, fat trimmed
2cups sliced onions (about 2 onions)
1cup water
1cup ketchup
¾cup packed brown sugar
½cup white vinegar
1Tbsp. kosher salt
1clove garlic, minced

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Brown brisket over medium-high heat in a large skillet, about 4 minutes per side. Stir together onions and remaining ingredients in a 5- to 6-qt. slow cooker. Add brisket and turn to coat. Cook, covered, until meat is tender, 5 to 6 hours on High or 10 to 12 hours on Low.
<lede>2.</lede> Transfer brisket to a cutting board. Tent lightly with foil and let stand 15 minutes before slicing against the grain. Skim any fat from sauce and serve sauce with brisket.
armagazine.com/sweet-and-sour-brisket
GLUTEN-FREE
PER 4-OZ. SERVING: 389 CAL; 18G FAT (7G SAT); 30G PRO; 26G CARB (1G FIBER, 23G SUGARS); 611MG SODIUM

“I browned the meat in a pan and then put it in a slow cooker for 12 hours on Low. It’s perfect: I can start the meat before work, and it’s ready when I have guests over in the evening.”
– FRESHJIVEN

Make It in a
Slow cooker
Zesty Slow Cooker Chicken Barbecue

HANDS-ON 15 MIN TOTAL 4 HR, 15 MIN SERVES 8
SUBMITTED BY SUZANNE ELIZABETH MASTAW
6,487 REVIEWS
Pile the pulled chicken with desired toppings, such as sliced cheese, red onion, and/or avocado.

components.html:
1(12-oz.) bottle barbecue sauce
½cup Italian salad dressing
¼cup packed brown sugar
2Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
6boneless, skinless chicken breasts
8hamburger buns

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Stir together barbecue sauce, salad dressing, brown sugar, and Worcestershire in a 6-qt. slow cooker. Add chicken and toss to coat. Cook, covered, 4 to 5 hours on Low.
<lede>2.</lede> Transfer chicken to a cutting board or plate, then shred with 2 forks. Return to slow cooker; stir to coat. Serve on hamburger buns.
armagazine.com/zesty-slow-cooker-chicken-barbecue
PER SERVING (INCLUDING BUNS): 401 CAL; 8G FAT (2G SAT); 33G PRO; 46G CARB (1G FIBER, 24G SUGARS); 895MG SODIUM

“I love this! The only change I made was to add ½ cup diced onion and 1 tsp. liquid smoke.”
– MARILYN WOODARD THOMPSON
